data.message:
In Android, every app is run in its own sandbox, it has no direct effect  on other apps.

The sandbox forces you to use the permissions available in the Android framework, and none of these allow the functionality you just described.

So yes, you'll need to root the device first to implement something like that.

I don't have any android development experience, But there are non-root VPN based Ad-blockers, In theory you can create a similar in-concept ad-blocker where you can block all the preferred apps domains.

https://github.com/adblockplus/adblockplusandroid
Check how AdBlock+ works on Android without root, you'll have to know JNI though to understand how this code works.
